title: Paul Pogba to Juventus: Man United star's brother persuaded 2012 exit despite Fergie visit
text: Paul Pogba to Juventus: Man United star's brother persuaded 2012 exit despite Fergie visit MATHIAS POGBA persuaded his brother to leave Manchester United four years ago - even though the club were desperate for him to stay. PUBLISHED: 00:01, Wed, Feb 22, 2017 | UPDATED: 00:14, Wed, Feb 22, 2017 A lack of game time saw then 19-year-old Paul Pogba exit Old Trafford for Italian giants Juventus. Manchester United allowed the midfielder to go for less than £1million. But four hugely successful seasons in Serie A saw the France international earn his way back to Manchester for a world-record £89m. GETTY Paul Pogba left   2012 before earning an £89m return from Juventus last summer At the time though, Sir Alex Ferguson was not looking to offload the young talent, and even visited the Pogba family home with United captain Patrice Evra to talk him into sticking it out in England. But Mathias feared his sibling would emulate Arsenal’s Danny Welbeck and Everton’s Tom Cleverley in being sent out on loan, and a permanent departure resulted. “I told Paul in 2012 that he had to leave United for the sake of his career,” Pogba told De Telegraaf . "You can ask him this for yourself.
